text.section: In Part I of this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Central Collection Unit" means the Central Collection Unit in the Department of Budget and Management.
"Child" means a person under the age of 18 years.

section.section: "Crime" does not include a violation of the Transportation Article that is not punishable by a term of confinement.

text.section:
"Defendant" means a person:
who has received probation before judgment;
who has been found guilty of a crime, even if the defendant has been found not criminally responsible; or
whose plea of nolo contendere to a crime has been accepted by the court.
"Division" means the Division of Parole and Probation.
"Judgment of restitution" means a direct order for payment of restitution or an order for payment of restitution that is a condition of probation in an order of probation.

"Liable parent" means a parent:
whose child has committed a crime or delinquent act; and
who has been ordered to pay restitution under § 11-604 of this subtitle.
"Restitution obligor" means a defendant, child respondent, or liable parent against whom a judgment of restitution has been entered.

"Victim" means:
a person who suffers death, personal injury, or property damage or loss as a direct result of a crime or delinquent act; or
if the person is deceased, the personal representative of the estate of the person.
